intro: Mendoncia schottiana var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leaved mendoncia, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its unique rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding structure. The plant exhibits glabrous (smooth) foliage, which distinguishes it from other varieties within the species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests or rocky outcrops. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
